definition: to size sb up/to look sb up and down/to take the measure of/to suppose/to reckon
to beat/to strike/to hit/to break/to type/to mix up/to build/to fight/to fetch/to make/to tie up/to issue/to shoot/to calculate/to play (a game)/since/from
capacity/quantity/amount/to estimate/abbr. for 量詞|量词[liang4 ci2], classifier (in Chinese grammar)/measure word

sentences.english: These three humpbacks came over to me to check me out.
sentences.chinese: 这三只座头鲸游到我这来打量我。

sentences.english: I just sized up the short and gaunt guy in front of me.
sentences.chinese: 我仔细地打量着眼前这个骨瘦如柴的家伙。

sentences.english: As if unsure of where he is, she hesitated and looked around.
sentences.chinese: 她仿佛茫然不知声身在何处，犹豫地向四周打量。

sentences.english: In the daylight I examined her perfect body inch by inch.
sentences.chinese: 日光下，我一寸一寸地打量着她那完美的胴体。

sentences.english: Look at John checking Money out. Do you think he will ask her out?
sentences.chinese: 你瞧约翰在打量莫尼呢。你觉得他会约她外出幽会吗？

sentences.english: Pass, such as when pretending to casually looked elsewhere.
sentences.chinese: 等擦肩而过时，忽又装作漫不经心地打量着别处。

sentences.english: He considered the man for some time before speaking to him .
sentences.chinese: 他打量了那人一会儿才跟他说话。

sentences.english: I have the new teacher the double - O.
sentences.chinese: 我仔细打量了这位新来的老师。

sentences.english: The colonel drank more gin and began to stare at Hooper.
sentences.chinese: 那位上校又喝了几杯酒，开始打量胡珀。

sentences.english: I regarded him once more in this dim light.
sentences.chinese: 借着昏暗的光线，我再次打量了他一番。
她很有兴趣地打量着他的面孔。

sentences.english: Noan-noan sits ashore Su Fei's left and conjectures the crowd on always sides.
sentences.chinese: 暖暖坐在苏斐的左位，打量着四周的人群。

sentences.english: He looked the applicant up and down.
sentences.chinese: 他上上下下地打量那个求职者。

sentences.english: She surveyed Sophie from top to toe in a disarmingly frank way.
sentences.chinese: 她以让人放心的坦率目光把索菲从头到脚打量了一番。

sentences.english: As you look around your room or entire house for that matter it seems impossible.
sentences.chinese: 你四下打量你的房间或是整个屋子，看来无从下手。

definition: to run one's eyes over/to sweep one's eyes over
to shoot a glance/glance/to appear in a flash
to look around/to peep (through a crack)/to peer at/to throw a look at
to look in all directions (idiom)/to glance around
to look at/to see/to see (a doctor)/to visit
to take a furtive look at
to take aim/(fig.) to aim one's looks at/to glance at
to cast sidelong glances at sb
